First, we need to understand what thetan levels are. According to Scientology, thetan levels refer to the various stages of spiritual awareness and development a person can achieve through Scientology practices. These levels are not found in the Bible or any other religious text. 

Next, we need to examine the New Testament specifically. The New Testament is a collection of writings that document the life and teachings of Jesus Christ and the early Christian Church. It does not mention the concept of thetan levels or Scientology in any way. 

Therefore, the answer to the question is (B) no, thetan levels are not found in the New Testament.

Firstly, it's important to understand what thetan levels are. Thetan levels are a core concept in Scientology, the practice of which was founded by science-fiction author L. Ron Hubbard. Thetans are considered to be immortal spiritual beings that are distinct from the physical body. Thetan levels refer to different stages of spiritual progression on the path toward enlightenment, with each level representing an increased understanding of the nature of the universe.

Now, turning to the New Testament, it is a collection of writings that make up the second part of the Christian Bible. The New Testament documents the life, teachings, death, and resurrection of Jesus Christ and the establishment of the early Christian church. The New Testament does not discuss or mention the concept of thetan levels or anything similar to Scientology.

Therefore, the correct answer to the multiple choice question is (B) no, thetan levels are not found in the New Testament.
